website_summaries.verdict: A classic beginner unicycle that children won't outgrow.
pros: This is a unicycle that you can learn on and continue using without outgrowing
Features unicycle saddle with front and rear scuff guards
Larger wheel gives you a smooth ride
cons: A few customers reported missing pieces, which were replaced by the manufacturer

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner unicycle
customer_reviews.text: The unicycle seems to be well made. It came initially without the hardware for assembly. It took a while to be able to receive the needed hardware, but once it's all together, it feels solid. I wish the clamp for holding the seat post were a bit easier to lock down solidly, or maybe quick release so it could be adjusted up or down more easily, but overall, it's a good quality unicycle for the low price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Weak cranks leads to stripped threads after just 2 days of riding and now my pedal falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: 1st Unicycle I received was missing all the hardware and no book, pretty disappointing to open it on Christmas. The replacement Unicycle had no pedals and no quick release lever. I am hoping once I receive all the parts it will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Unicycle was too big
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and assembled it. Unfortunately the unicycle did not fit me even though I was counseled that my height of 5' 4" and inseam of 28.5" would fit the frame. The seller does not take returns that have been opened. I now have to take it to a bike shop to have the seat post sawed down. Be warned you should have a 30" inseam at the very least.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M Keefe

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT I WAS LOOKING FORWARD
customer_reviews.text: The unit complies with my expectations... looks good, rides well, comfortable... unfortunately nuts were missing but I was able to install replacements nuts... I was dying to ride and I couldn't wait... It deserves a 5 stars but the missing parts took it down to 4... still I would recommend the product specially for beginners or for those (like me) that just wants to have some fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and fun
customer_reviews.text: Don't know much about unicycles, but this one seems good. It's solid and seems well made. Needed to be put together upon arrival, but that wasn't too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing unicycle. This size is the best
customer_reviews.text: Amazing unicycle. This size is the best. My brother bought the size smaller then this one and your so tired in 3 mins. This size it’s smoother and less exhausting
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Greene

customer_reviews.title: College kids love it
customer_reviews.text: I ride all over my college campus and have gotten a ton of compliments from people, so I guess the several weeks it took to learn were worth it! Unicycle looks awesome and is plenty durable. I'm 5'7" and it's not too big for me, but if you're any shorter you'll probably want to buy the 20" or at least cut the seat post down. Happy riding!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent first unicycle
customer_reviews.text: It looks great and is just fine for me to ride at 6' 2". My only negative experience is that the inner tube did burst once (not while riding), probably my own fault, but it was very easy for me to replace.
customer_reviews.author: David Morin

customer_reviews.title: Too tall
customer_reviews.text: I was soooo excited when i got it being a teen im only 5'1 so when i went to ride it was way too tall so keep that in mind. But i also thought it was verry good quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Feels like it will last. Has a strong seat. Very important on a unicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Evelynveere

customer_reviews.title: Loves this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loves it. Rides it nearly every evening. Wishes for a more comfortable seat.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Unicycling For You and Me
customer_reviews.text: Love this unicycle. Bearings turn smoothly and the ride is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: well built
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built, no complaints. The seat and pedals are still going strong, even after several falls as I am learning.
customer_reviews.author: m8rimCauthon

customer_reviews.title: Great Find
customer_reviews.text: Very nice unicycle it was missing pieces but they were soon sent to me. The seat is hard and uncomfortable but it looks super cool.
customer_reviews.author: 65dodgedart

customer_reviews.title: The unicycle itself seems to be very solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I was missing pedals when first delivered, but the company mailed them separately within a few days. The unicycle itself seems to be very solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started great but didn't get that far.
customer_reviews.text: Unicycle did well at first but after four or five times riding the crank stripped out and pedal fell off. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: chrispen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Top notch unicycle. Well worth the money. No complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy design. Has held up well after many...MANY falls. Love the color!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Extine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. I appreciate the wide tires
customer_reviews.text: Still learning to ride it. Excellent quality. I appreciate the wide tires.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Lankhorst

customer_reviews.title: Buff fun
customer_reviews.text: I road in high school. I am now 40. My 5 year old was learning to ride his bike while I was re-learning how to ride unicycle. We spent lots of time laughing. Side benefits include core, quad and calf workouts. For added thrill go helmetless.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Great unicycle
customer_reviews.text: This unicycle is very sturdy and rides really smoothly. I recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: natalie a.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and multi-functional unicycle.
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough and attractive beginners unicycle. I am 6’3” and learned to ride on this. I rode gravel roads and dirt paths mainly. My brother in law is shorter and we just used a hacksaw and cut seat post down to fit him. I believe with this simple mod you could easily adapt to someone much, much shorter. Definitely way better looking than a lot of other unicycles in its price range too. Pedals and seat clamp are worst things about it....no reason not to buy though. Not the best for long rides, I stay within a couple miles or this thing will wear you out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sun Unicycle Flat Top 24 inch 2014 Green & Black
product_meta.description: Rugged Flat Top high tensile steel frame Lightweight anodized alloy wheels Long lasting sealed bearing hub Classic unicycle saddle with front and rear scuff guards Secure single-bolt seat post clamp Fast-rolling street tread 20" or 24" Wheel sizes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars41 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
